text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
make a very special cake called one way
in Vietnamese Bangui also means cookies
so some might be mixed second by the
name of this the one way that I'm making

it's the Vietnamese version of the Queen
Ankou which is pretty popular in
Malaysia Singapore and all that it's
decides in a turtle shell shape and
therefore it's a symbol of longevity and
good luck this cake or dumpling is very
popular as a snack as well as ritual
offerings why the Chinese version is
mostly made with mung beans in the
Vietnamese version is more often made
with coconut feelings they are chewy and
soft and tender at the same time so
let's begin so let's start off with the
feelings first for the feelings you will
need 170 gram of shredded coconut
roasted sesame and peanuts and 80 gram
of brown sugar you also need a 50 gram
of glutinous rice flour and banana leaf
for the base check the infobox below for
the us measurement if you like heat a
pan on medium and then ask the shredded
young coconut and sugar then stir and
cook for about 2 to 3 minutes until the
sugar is melted next myth 15 gram of
glutinous rice flour with 2 tbsp of
water in a bowl and pour into the pan
then mix well for another 2 minutes or
so then after roasted peanut and sesame
and then turn off the heat leave to cool
then do you want to divide this into 10
equal portions that's about 20 gram each
for the dough you will need to nut gram
of glutinous rice flour 1 tablespoon of
normal plain rice flour 10
leaves and hundred 90 ml of water 1/4
teaspoon of salt and 50 gram of sugar
Valley chapter panglang leaves and cry
with 190 ml of water
you let the mixture go through a mesh
strainer to extract the green juice this
car the fibrous parts to the panga juice
add a tablespoon of sugar
and then heat in the microwave for just
one minute at 800 watts or you can also
heat on the stove until it reaches about
80 degrees sensors that 176 Fahrenheit
next in a large mixing bowl combine the
glutinous rice flour with the plain rice
flour and a pinch of salt make a well in
the center of the flower bowl and slowly
pouring the juice mix wooden spatula
until the juice is well absorbed and
then when it's cool enough you can knead
with your hands until a doughy formed
that just takes about 2 to 3 minutes and
then you take a piece of plastic wrap
cover it and let it rest for about 20
minutes next divide the dough into 10
equal portions at about 25 to 30 gram
each and make each in two or more and
then press down to form a disk and then
place the filling in the center and
gather the edges and pinch together
try not to lick the feeling because when
you boil it will break shape it into a
nice round bar and then grease the mole
with some vegetable oil press the
dumpling into the mold then tap the 3
side of the mold with forks and let the

leaf if you do not have a mold just
gently make it into your round ball and
press down gently on a piece of banana

about 7 to 9 minutes from the point that
the water is boiling then take out and
brush with some oil on top of the cake
so it has a really shiny look and the
oil also helps you prevent the cake from
